reviews.text: We stayed there our first night during our holidays in Croatia. The hotel was very easy to find even we had never visited Split before. The airport bus arrives only few hundred meters from the hotel, it is situated just on the Riva.
reviews.title: Great location by the sea

reviews.text: The location is perfect - it sits on the Split Marina where the Croatia Airlines bus service runs to/from Split Airport and all the major ferry services are basically in front of the hotel. The enterance is hard to find among all the cafe's.
reviews.title: Unbeatable, given the alternatives ...
Very good hotel, and can't beat the location
reviews.text: I found the hotel useful before departing Split as most flights leave Split Airport around 2pm hence if you are coming in from say Hvar Island or any of the others you have to spend the night in Split otherwise you're cutting it close.
In terms of the alternative - the rest of the hotels in Split resemble prisons (apart from Hotel President - which is situated further into Split town and is more expensive).
reviews.title: Great location, but average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in June as the start of an island hopping holiday in Croatia. We found the rooms small but clean and had all the facilities we needed.
reviews.title: Good hotel in good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was superb and very handy for the bus station and ferry port.
reviews.title: Just what we wanted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: our requirements; air conditioning, reasonable accommodation, proximity to the old town/city centre and decent price (why pay a fortune if you're only staying a night?) the Adriana did not dissappoint. Yes the hotel staff can appear a little abrupt, but anyone who has spent time in a Slavic country will know that it is more to do with the culture and style of communication that is prevalent. I would have no problem staying there again as I disagree with some of the reviews posted here.
reviews.title: good location, neat shower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This “hotel” (that makes it sound better than it is) is over a terribly smoky restaurant, so checking in requires stinking up yourself and all of your belongings before even cramming into the tiny elevator and making it up to your room. It only gets worse from there. The rooms are horribly dingy, with worn carpet, stained window treatments, and walls you want to avoid touching. Trying to sleep in the bed left me feeling dirty, plus it’s not comfortable and there’s not even a comforter to make it look like a decent place to sleep. On the “service” (that’s nonexistent) front, my friend and I were sent to a room that had one double bed. When I went back down to the desk and explained that I had requested a room with 2 twin beds, the obnoxious person told me at the desk told me that I’d need to pay 40 kuna more. Although I had e-mail confirmation of the room I requested being the initial price, this worker and another refused to budge. It seems ridiculous that they were more concerned with making so little (less than 8 USD) extra money than with honoring their word, achieving customer satisfaction, and gaining future business. The hotel options in Split are limited, but doing this small city as a day trip would be better than staying at Hotel Adriana. Half of what we paid would have been too much for this unprofessional dump.
reviews.title: Basic but Great Location
